Week of January 12, 2015 <http://startupgrind.com/2015/> STARTUP GRIND WORKSHOP: TIM MCCOY, "LESSONS FROM THE PRODUCT DESIGN PRO" Join us Tuesday, February 10th, 1:40 PM - 2:00 PM at Startup Grind 2015 in Redwood City for "Lessons from the Product Design Pro", Tim McCoy.
Tim leads the Product Design practice for Pivotal Labs, the agile development services unit of Pivotal Software. For over 20 years, Tim has been designing and building software for startups and Fortune 100 companies, helping these companies understand their customers and create compelling products and services. Active in the agile and lean startup communities, Tim is a mentor and advocate for balanced teams of designers, product managers, and developers. REGISTER <http://startupgrind.com/2015/> EPISODE #11: WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 14TH, "SO WHAT HAPPENS WHEN I PUSH AN APP ANYWAY?" <http://pivotal.io/podcasts> Join us this week, Wednesday, January 14th for Episode #11 of our All Things Pivotal Podcast Series, "So What Happens When I Push an App Live, Anyway?"
Lean how to easily push an application to Pivotal CF in this technical talk. Simon gives us the steps, the preconditions, and what to avoid when deploying to Pivotal CF. SUBSCRIBE <http://www.pivotal.io/podcasts> PIVOTAL PEOPLE- GAVIN SHERRY ON ENGINEERING POSTGRESQL, GREENPLUM, HAWQ AND MORE <http://blog.pivotal.io/big-data-pivotal/pivotal-people/pivotal-people-gavin-sherry-on-engineering-postgresql-greenplum-hawq-and-more> In this post, we do a Q&A session with Pivotal's vice president of engineering for data, Gavin Sherry. Gavin has played a major role in developing a number of well-known data-centric products, including significant contributions to PostgreSQL. Before big data was common, he joined Greenplum to help build the massively parallel processing engine for analyzing petabytes of data. At Pivotal, he helped lead the development of HAWQ, creating a new era of data platforms with SQL on Hadoop. In this interview, he shares his history as well as his views on where the market is heading and how his products are being used to help companies become more data driven.

With an incredibly dynamic and fast-paced market, the year is sure to experience tons of innovation and market maturation that will yield exciting examples of just how significantly expertly built algorithms can benefit businesses.
